channel.title: Help with static IP Please?
channel.description:
Well, for some reason my wireless connection goes out every, 5 or so hours? And to bring the connection back up, I need to unplug my router and modem and plug them back in, then my IP Changes, So I think I need a static ip. But when I use this guide here.
http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-xp.htm
But when I get to the part where I need to open my command prompt, I open it and type in IP config and this is what happens.
I type in CMD
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2lbz8ly.png[/img]
I Hit OK and this is what shows up.
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/dtg5f.png[/img]
I type in ipconfig..
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/154y8pi.png[/img]
I get this error..
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/120t0ms.png[/img]
I do not know the problem, and All I need to know is my 2 DNS Servers, but I can not find them. I am on a wireless internet trying to setup a static IP :( someone please help me?
I am using this guide to portforward.
http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Dlink/DI-624/Soulseek.htm
:( PLEASEE HELP :(:(:(

item.title: Help with static IP Please?
item.dc:creator: @de_dust89 de dust89
item.description:
@de_dust89 wrote:

Worked TYVM, I can’t rep, would if I could though sorry, but TY!!

Hey, now I need to find my DNS servers but I can’t =-/ Where is it on this?

I only need the DNS Atm

Read full topic

item.title: Help with static IP Please?
item.dc:creator: @pur4hyb1rd pur4hyb1rd
item.description:
@pur4hyb1rd wrote:

i can tell you how to fix this

Ok right click my computer and then click properties goto the advanced tab then click on environmental variables
their will be like two boxes one called user variables for administrator and another called system variables

In the user variables for administrator it will say new edit delete click new

Variable name:path
Variable value: C:\Windows\system32; The semi Colen is very important i suggest copy and paste rep me if it is fixed

Read full topic

item.title: Help with static IP Please?
item.dc:creator: @de_dust89 de dust89
item.description:
@de_dust89 wrote:

Well, for some reason my wireless connection goes out every, 5 or so hours? And to bring the connection back up, I need to unplug my router and modem and plug them back in, then my IP Changes, So I think I need a static ip. But when I use this guide here.

http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-xp.htm

But when I get to the part where I need to open my command prompt, I open it and type in
IP config and this is what happens.

I type in CMD

I Hit OK and this is what shows up.

I type in ipconfig…

I get this error…

I do not know the problem, and All I need to know is my 2 DNS Servers, but I can not find them. I am on a wireless internet trying to setup a static IP someone please help me?

I am using this guide to portforward.

http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Dlink/DI-624/Soulseek.htm

PLEASEE HELP :(:(
